intro: Didymocarpus biserratus, commonly known as the serrated fruit-bearing plant, is a species native to Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many members of its family. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
